source_text: $(br2)You can check the following page for images on how the ME Kitchen Station looks when connected (purple screen) and disconnected (black screen).
target_text: $(br2)MEキッチンステーションが接続時（紫の画面）と未接続時（黒い画面）にどのように見えるかの画像については、次のページを確認してください。

source_text: When not connected, the screen will be black.
target_text: 接続されていない場合、画面は黒くなります。

source_text: Disconnected
target_text: 切断

source_text: When connected, the screen will be purple.
target_text: 接続されている場合、画面は紫色になります。

source_text: Connected

source_text: Sebastrn's Mods!
target_text: SebastrnのMod!

source_text: , you can find it using JEI or REI!
target_text: , JEIまたはREIを使用して探してください!

source_text: A mod that allows you to use items from your $(5)Applied Energistics 2$() network inventory directly in your $(6)Cooking for Blockheads$() kitchen multi-block!$(br2)One new block is added to Minecraft.$(br2)If you have downloaded the mod, you'll see the chapters/entries on the right. If not, you can download it $(l:https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/applied-cooking)here$()

A mod that allows you to use items from your $(1)Refined Storage$() network inventory directly in your $(6)Cooking for Blockheads$() kitchen multi-block!$(br2)Two new blocks and one item are added to Minecraft.$(br2)If you have downloaded the mod, you'll see the chapters/entries on the right. If not, you can download it $(l:https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/refined-cooking)here$()

The ME Kitchen Station is all you need to connect $(6)CFB$() with $(5)Applied Energistics 2$().$(br2)Once you have it, you'll need to configure it in an $(5)AE2$() ME Security Terminal as if it were a Wireless Terminal. Then, place it as a part of your $(6)CFB$() kitchen multi-block and that's all. You can craft items in your cooking table using your $(5)AE2$() network inventory!

MelonCube's goal is to provide the best possible service and product at a price that is good value for money.$(br2)If you need hosting for Minecraft, please click the button below $(bold)AND$() use my 25 percent discount code:$(br2)$(bold)Sebastrn$()$(br2)I appreciate it!

The Kitchen Access Point is one of the blocks you'll need to connect $(6)CFB$() with $(1)Refined Storage$(). Think of it as an $(1)RS$() Network Transmitter.$(br2)Once you have it, you'll need to place it as part of your $(1)RS$() network. A Kitchen Network Card can go inside this block to connect it to a Kitchen Station and share your $(1)RS$() network inventory!

The Kitchen Network Card is one of the items you'll need to connect $(6)CFB$() with $(1)Refined Storage$().$(br2)Once you have it, you'll need to configure it by right-clicking a Kitchen Station with it. Then, put the card inside a Kitchen Access Point on your $(1)RS$() network. Now you can craft items using your $(1)RS$() network inventory!
$(br2)If you play or have played with $(1)Refined Storage$(), you'll see similarities between the Network Transmitter, Network Receiver and the Network Card.

The Kitchen Station is one of the blocks you'll need to connect $(6)CFB$() with $(1)Refined Storage$(). Think of it as an $(1)RS$() Network Receiver.$(br2)Once you have it, you'll need to place it as part of your $(6)CFB$() kitchen multi-block, right-click it with a Kitchen Network Card and put the card inside a Kitchen Access Point that's connected to your $(1)RS$() network.
If you're getting this message, it means you've installed either Refined Cooking or Applied Cooking. If you want to know more about them, you can craft the manual/book called

Hi $(playername)!$(br2)Connect your $(6)Cooking For Blockheads (CFB)$() kitchen multi-block with your favorite Network Storage mod.$(br2)$(4)Refined Cooking$() connects $(6)CFB$() with $(1)Refined Storage$().$(br2)$(2)Applied Cooking$() connects $(6)CFB$() with $(5)Applied Energistics 2$().
